page.title: 14St.Mary's Church cont'd
page.content: The small graveyard surrounding the church contains the graves of the Jenner family who once held Wenvoe Castle and owned Barry Docks. The graves are attended daily by a local character, called Trevor, who is 74 years old. He has been doing this for the past six years. He is also a master of topiary and has shaped a teapot, cup and saucer from the hedge in his own garden, opposite the churchyard. Situated near the church is a war memorial commemmorating the heroism of soldiers from the village who gave their lives in the Great War of 1914-1919, including some members of the Jenner family. The names have been inscribed on a piece of rough local stone.
